docs.snippet: Florida State’s Jameis Winston, who faced scrutiny this season after being accused of rape, finished 1,501 points ahead of A J McCarron for the seventh-largest victory margin in Heisman history....
docs.lead_paragraph: Florida State’s Jameis Winston, who faced scrutiny this season after being accused of rape, finished 1,501 points ahead of A J McCarron for the seventh-largest victory margin in Heisman history.
docs.abstract: Florida State quarterback Jameis Winston wins the Heisman Trophy, college football’s pre-eminent honor; accusation of rape, for which he was never charged, appears to have had a minimal impact on the actual vote, although 13 percent of the 928 voters left Winston off their ballots.

headline.main: Winston Earns Heisman in a Runaway
headline.print_headline: Winston Earns Heisman in a Runaway

docs.snippet: WROBEL--Bruce James, 56, of NYC passed away on December 10, 2013. Bruce was born in Chicago, IL on July 5, 1957 to his beloved parents, Virginia I Wrobel and the late Walter J Wrobel. After a very successful academic and athletic career at Evergre...
docs.lead_paragraph: WROBEL--Bruce James, 56, of NYC passed away on December 10, 2013. Bruce was born in Chicago, IL on July 5, 1957 to his beloved parents, Virginia I Wrobel and the late Walter J Wrobel. After a very successful academic and athletic career at Evergreen Park High School in Evergreen Park, IL, Bruce went on to the Massachusetts Institute of Technology where he developed his passion for energy development, drove the establishment of a varsity football team after a 70-year hiatus, and formed many treasured and lifelong friendships. After receiving degrees in economics and resource management, Bruce cofounded MITEX Corporation, a hydropower company later sold to Sithe Energies. As a Sithe Energies executive and eventual Sithe Global Power CEO, Bruce was responsible for the identification and development of dozens of power plants throughout the world. Power plant development eventually took him to Africa where he fell in love with the people and became committed to addressing many of the challenges preventing African nations from overcoming poverty. Whether building power plants to deliver reliable energy and much needed jobs (SITHE GLOBAL), laying fiber optic cable on the ocean floor to enable global connectivity and access (SEACOM), or helping nations realize the full value of their natural resources (GAPCO), Bruce envisioned real solutions and worked tirelessly to secure the required funding and manage the projects through to completion. Always a generous and giving man, Bruce formalized his philanthropy through many charitable organizations, including his own All for Africa, with school construction and education being his favored focus. He was fueled by the joy on student's faces when able to receive their education in a real school environment for the first time. Bruce is survived by his greatest assets -- his loving mother Virginia (Evergreen Park, IL), his once wife and now dear friend Marlo Marron, his beloved children, Dylan and Summer, his wonderful siblings Dawn (Bob Mason) of Beecher, IL, Walter (Susan) of Houston, TX, and Sandra (Robbie Robinson) of Redwood City, CA, his six handsome nephews, and a world full of cherished friends and respected colleagues. For those wishing to continue Bruce's legacy, donations in his memory can be made to the Bruce Wrobel Memorial Foundation.

docs.snippet: Many of Mike Hale’s favorite television series this year — “The Hollow Crown,” “Prisoners of War” and “Moone Boy” among them — were produced abroad....
docs.lead_paragraph: Many of Mike Hale’s favorite television series this year — “The Hollow Crown,” “Prisoners of War” and “Moone Boy” among them — were produced abroad.
docs.abstract: Mike Hale lists his favorite television shows of 2013, noting that many among them were produced abroad, adding interesting twist to so-called golden age of American television.

docs.snippet: More than Florence, Rome or Venice, the author argues, it is Naples that is one of the most romantic cities in the world....
docs.lead_paragraph: More than Florence, Rome or Venice, the author argues, it is Naples that is one of the most romantic cities in the world.
docs.abstract: Rachel Donadio travel article on Naples, Italy, which she claims is one of the most romantic cities in world; contends it is a place of magnificent chaos, and a home to the forces of darkness and light.

docs.snippet: While the Korean industrial group dominates some electronics categories, its chairman, Lee Kun-hee, warns employees against complacency....
docs.lead_paragraph: While the Korean industrial group dominates some electronics categories, its chairman, Lee Kun-hee, warns employees against complacency.
docs.abstract: Korean industrial group Samsung, $288 billion behemoth that is among the most profitable in the world, dominates some electronics categories including smartphone market; its chairman Lee Kun-hee, however, warns employees against complacency; developing new products is no longer enough for company, as it wants to create devices that define completely new categories.

byline.original: By ERIC PFANNER and BRIAN X. CHEN
